resources.string: Are you presenting in the conference?
Please choose a number from 1 - 7 that best desribes your agreement with the following statements. \n 1=Strongly disagree - 7=Strongly agree
I lost track of the world while I was listening to this lecture.
I still paid attention to my surroundings while I was listening the lecture.
I was completely captivated by this lecture.
What was your engagement level during this lecture?
In your opinion, what was the engagement level of the instructor during this lecture?
What was your attention level during this lecture?
During which part of this lecture did you pay more attention? (i.e., first 15 minutes, last 15 minutes)
Open Apps with usage access settings
Failed to retrieve app usage statistics. You may need to enable access for this app through Settings > Security > Apps with usage access
Could you please answer some questions?
The purpose of this study is assess the user’s well-being over time and the factors that may influence it, using smartphones.
What will you do in the study:

The smartphone will unobtrusively gather some sensor’s data (e.g: GPS, Wifi, Accelerometer, Bluetooth, Number of App used,..). You will be asked to fill-in short questionnaires twice per day. Your answers and the data gathered from the smartphone will allow us to get information about your subjective perception of your well-being and to understand which are the main factors that may contribute to your happiness. You can refrain from answering any question you might prefer not to answer (e.g., because it makes you uncomfortable) and you can stop the survey at any time.
The study will require few minutes of your daily time.

The information and data collected in this study will be stored safely and handled confidentially. Your data will be anonymized through the assignment of an alphanumerical code and your name will never be mentioned in connection to the data or in any report. Any attempt to deduce your identity from the data is explicitly forbidden by our data analysis policy.
Your participation in the study is completely voluntary. You have the right to withdraw from the study at any time without penalty and to require your data to be entirely and permanently deleted.
I confirmed that I carefully read and understand the information reported above and that I agree to participate in the research study

In the last century depression and mental health disorders among students and academics have been noted as a significantly increasing problem. Addressing this problem has become a key concern for several Universities. Recently a quite new branch of psychology, called positive psychology, rather than threating mental illness, has focused its attention more on personal growth and happiness. What is new with positive psychology is trying to make intervention to increase well-being since it has as side effect the decreasing of suffering. Happiness, also known as subjective wellbeing, has been defined as a combination of satisfaction of one\'s life with positive and negative emotional reactions. Positive psychology indicates that happiness can be affected and improved in different ways. Several daily external factors can contribute to the individual\'s overall well-being, such as physical activities, workload, mobility, social interaction, sleep quality,.. In order to improve our quality of life and increase our resilience to adversity, it\'s really important to keep track of their influence in our daily life. Traditionally well-being has been explored using questionnaires and interviews, this approach however presents several drawbacks, it\’s time consuming and difficult to manage in large scale. Nowadays people of different ages carry their smartphone all the time and interact with it several times per day. This makes smartphone an emerging and attractive option for collecting tones of daily data from users and environmental context, that can be analysed to get information of human\'s attitude, interests and health.

This study belongs to a Master\’s thesis project. The main goal of the project is to investigate, using smartphones, which are the main factors that affect the well-being and to which extent they contribute to the participants\' happiness changes over time. Researchers have been shown that depression contribute to a reduction of mobility. Based on that we have decided to focus our attention mainly on the correlation between location information and well-being changes. During the data collection some feedbacks will be provided to the users which can become more aware of their well-being changes.
Contact person if you have questions about the study:

ATTENTION! If you check this checkbox you are confirming that you want to leave the study. This action implies that you no longer participate to our study and all your data will be removed from your phone and our remote storage. If you really want to leave the study, please, contact our staff members before confirming.
"You are unenrolled from the study. If you want to enroll again, update your profile in the top right menu by disabling the "Leave study" option.

2. How much time have you spent at your job?
3. How many people have you interacted with?
Please answer the following questions by marking them with a number from 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree).
1. I lead a purposeful and meaningful life
2. My social relationships are supportive and rewarding
3. I am engaged and interested in my daily activities
4. I actively contribute to the happiness and well-being of others
5. I am competent and capable in activities that are important to me
6. I am a good person and live a good life
7. I am optimistic about my future
Please answer the following questions by marking from 1 (never) to 5 (very often)

The questions in this scale ask you about your feelings and thoughts in general. In each case, you will be asked to indicate by selecting how often you felt or thought a certain way. Please answer the following questions by marking from 1 (never) to 5 (very often).
How often are you upset because of something that happened unexpectedly?
How often do you feel that you are unable to control the important things in your life?
How often do you feel nervous and "stressed"?
How often do you feel confident about your ability to handle your personal problems?
How often do you feel that things are going your way?
How often do you find that you cannot cope with all the things that you have to do?
How often are you able to control irritations in your life?
How often do you feel that you are on top of things?
How often are you angered because of things that are outside of your control?
How often do you feel difficulties are pilling up so high that you cannot overcome them?

1: Never 
 2: Almost Never 
 3: Sometimes 
 4: Fairly Often 
 5: Very Often
Please answer the following questions by marking from 1 (never) to 5 (very often)
The following questions relate to your usual sleep habits during the past month. Your answers should indicate the most accurate reply for the majority of days and nights in the past month.
During the past month, when have you usually gone to bed at night?
During the past month, how long (in minutes) has it usually take you to fall asleep each night?
During the past month, when have you usually gotten up in the morning?
During the past month, how many hours of actual sleep did you get at night? (This may be different than the number of hours you spend in bed.)
During the past month, how often have you had trouble sleeping because you …
a) … cannot get to sleep within 30 minutes?
b) … wake up in the middle of the night or early morning?
c) … have to get up to use the bathroom?
j) … had trouble sleeping because of other reason(s) (please describe)? How often during the past month have you had trouble sleeping because of this?
During the past month, how would you rate your sleep quality overall?
During the past month, how often have you taken medicine (prescribed or “over the counter”) to help you sleep?
During the past month, how often have you had trouble staying awake while driving, eating meals, or engaging in social activity?
During the past month, how much of a problem has it been for you to keep up enough enthusiasm to get things done?
Do you have a bed partner or roommate?
If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had …
Long pauses between breaths while asleep
Legs twitching or jerking while you sleep
Episodes of disorientation or confusion during sleep
Other restlessness while you sleep; please describe:
Three or more times a week
Thank you for completing all the surveys!
Thank you for completing the survey!
Please answer the following questions by marking them from 1 (not at all) to 4 (nearly every day)
Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Mark every question with a number from
Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself, or that you are a failure, or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving aroung a lot more than usual
For each of the following statements and/or questions, please specify the point on the rating bar that you feel is most appropriate in describing you.
2. Compared to most of my peers, I consider myself:
3. Some people are generally very happy. They enjoy life regardless of what is going on, getting the most out of everything. To what extent does this characterization describe you?
4. Some people are generally not very happy. Although they are not depressed, they never seem as happy as they might be. To what extent does this characterization describe you?
Please answer the following questions by marking them with a number from 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree).

Below are five statements that you may agree or disagree with. Please pick a number from 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree) next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement. Please be open and honest in your responding.
In most ways my life is close to my ideal.
The conditions of my life are excellent.
I am satisfied with my life.
So far I have gotten the important things I want in life.
If I could live my life over, I would change almost nothing

Here are a number of personality traits that may or may not apply to you. Please pick a number from 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree) next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement. You should rate the extent to which the pair of traits applies to you, even if one characteristic applies more strongly than the other.

1: Disagree strong 
 2: Disagree moderately 
 3: Disagree a little 
 4: Neither agree or disagree 
 5: Agree a little 
 6: Agree moderately 
 7: Strongly agree
In general, how often are you bothered by the following problems. Please give your answers based on the following examples:
1. Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge.
2. Not being able to stop or control worrying.
3. Worrying too much about different things.
5. Being so restless that it is hard to sit still.
7. Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen.
